page.title: 05FARMING: LAVENDERS FARM
page.content: The Common Market milk quota limits the number of cows, mainly Jersey breed, to 35 on this dairy farm. An Aberdeen Angus bull is also kept. Electric fences divide the fields to control the grazing. The soil is sandy and soon dries out. Behind the 150 year old farm house is a diesel-pump well, 15 feet deep, which is used regularly. Two swans Beatrice and Benedict, live in the pond at the end of the orchard. The farmer, Mr. Whitehead, has planted about 2000 trees on his farm. He and his wife promote conservation. Interesting features include a 500 year old stone barn, a 4th Century B.C. statue of a man, the site of the former village butt and the drained millrace.
